treatment.description: Plants acaulescent to short-caulescent. Stems erect, to 2 m. Leaf blade lanceolate, 40–60 cm, apex long-tapering. Inflores-censes racemose, 8–18 dm; peduncle 0.3–0.5 m. Flowers 3.5–4.5(–5.2) cm; style 7–10 mm. Capsules deeply constricted, 3.5–5.5 cm.
treatment.discussion: J. L. Reveal (1977c) separated var. avia from var. kanabensis, and believed it to be more closely related to var. angustissima. S. L. Welsh et al. (1993) considered var. avia to be a northern, high elevation variant at the end of a cline within the species. It occurs in loamy, rocky soils instead of the sandy soils that the other varieties inhabit. Little is known about this variety.
